# 1. Loading palm data set and setting up for later analyses

**Clean up workspace**  
```{r}
rm(list=ls()) # remove all objects first; alternatively press CTRL+SHIFT+F10 to also unmap loaded packages
```
&nbsp;

**Load R packages & palm data set**  

```{r, include=FALSE}
library(dplyr)
library(sf)
library(raster)
library(BIEN)
library(ROCR)
library(performance)
```

```{r, eval=FALSE}
library(dplyr)
library(sf)
library(raster)
library(BIEN)
library(ROCR)
library(performance)
```
&nbsp;

For today's exercise, we will continue to use the Neotropical palm data set from [Kreft, H., Sommer, J.H. & Barthlott, W. (2006) The significance of geographic range size for spatial diversity patterns in Neotropical palms. _Ecography_, 29, 21-30](https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/full/10.1111/j.2005.0906-7590.04203.x).  

```{r}
species <- read.csv("data/palms_species_per_gridcell.csv")
```
&nbsp;

**Data inspection**
```{r, echo=TRUE}
head(species) 
str(species)
species$species <- paste(species$GENUS,species$EPITHET, sep = " ") # make new column combining 'Genus' and 'Epithet'

```
&nbsp;

**Create a subset of the palm data set (4 palm species)**

```{r, echo=TRUE}
species <- species[which(species$species %in% c("Geonoma pauciflora","Geonoma weberbaueri","Phytelephas tenuicaulis","Mauritia flexuosa")),]
unique(species$species) # list species in data set

species$species[which(species$species == "Geonoma weberbaueri")] <- "Geonoma undata" # Rename to accepted name in World Checklist of Vascular Plants  
```
&nbsp;


**Load GIS shapefile \& join it to species distribution data**  

```{r, echo=TRUE}
# read a polygon shapefile
grid <- st_read("data/30min_grid_select50/30min_grid_select50%.shp")

st_crs(grid) <- "+proj=longlat +ellps=WGS84 +no_defs" # remember to include coordinate system
#plot(st_geometry(grid))

# convert long table to a wide table
species <- species[,c("grid_id","species")]

species_grid <- as.data.frame.matrix(table(species))
species_grid <- data.frame(grid_id = as.integer(row.names(species_grid)), species_grid)

names(grid)[1] <- "grid_id"

grid <- left_join(grid, species_grid, by="grid_id")

grid[is.na(grid)] <- 0 # convert NAs to zeroes 
grid[1:5,1:5] # inspect data frame
```
Other options to convert 'long' data frames to 'wide' ones include 'dcast' via the _reshape2_ package or 'pivot_wider' via the 
_tidyr_ package.

# 2. Download point occurrences (presences)

For today's practical, we will use occurrence data downloaded from [BIEN](http://bien.nceas.ucsb.edu/bien/tools/). This file 
is also available via StudIP ('Data/Data/BIEN_data.csv).

```{r, echo=TRUE}
#spec_occ <- BIEN_occurrence_species(c("Geonoma pauciflora","Geonoma undata","Phytelephas tenuicaulis","Mauritia flexuosa"), cultivated = FALSE, only.new.world = TRUE) # Download via the internet (this can take quite some time!)

spec_occ <- read.csv("data/BIEN_data.csv") # Or load species occurrence data from disk

head(spec_occ)
dim(spec_occ) # how many observations?
```


```{r,echo=TRUE}
#species 2
plot(st_geometry(grid), col=ifelse(grid$Geonoma.undata==1,"#ef8a62","#7fbf7b"), border=FALSE, main = "Geonoma undata")

#species 3
plot(st_geometry(grid), col=ifelse(grid$Phytelephas.tenuicaulis==1,"#ef8a62","#7fbf7b"), border=FALSE, main = "Phytelephas tenuicaulis")
```

&nbsp;

# 3.  Create pseudo‐absences (background data) 

Pseudo-absences are necessary because occurrence data sets (like BIEN) only record presences and not true absences. Therefore, we must generate pseudo-absences, i.e. possible locations where a species doesn't occur.  

**Make spatial points dataframe from grid**  
```{R, echo=TRUE}

grid_centroids <- st_centroid(grid)
grid_centroids$present <- 0

par(mfrow=c(1,1))
plot(st_geometry(grid_centroids), pch=3)
```
&nbsp;


**Make spatialPoint objects for occurrences of each species**

```{r, echo=TRUE}

americas <- st_read("data/americas/americas.shp") # add shape file showing the borders of the Neotropics  
st_crs(americas) <- "+proj=longlat +ellps=WGS84 +no_defs"

# Geonoma pauciflora

geo_pau = st_as_sf(spec_occ[which(spec_occ$scrubbed_species_binomial == "Geonoma pauciflora"),c("longitude","latitude")], coords = c("longitude", "latitude"), crs = "+proj=longlat +ellps=WGS84 +no_defs")
geo_pau$present = 1

# add pseudo-absences
set.seed(100)
geo_pau_abs <- rbind(grid_centroids[sample(nrow(grid_centroids),nrow(geo_pau), replace = TRUE),"present"],geo_pau)

par(mfrow=c(2,2))

plot(st_geometry(geo_pau_abs), col=ifelse(geo_pau_abs$present==1,"#ef8a62","#7fbf7b"), main="Geonoma pauciflora", pch = 3)
plot(st_geometry(americas), add=TRUE)

# Geonoma undata
geo_und = st_as_sf(spec_occ[which(spec_occ$scrubbed_species_binomial == "Geonoma undata"),c("longitude","latitude")], coords = c("longitude", "latitude"), crs = "+proj=longlat +ellps=WGS84 +no_defs")
geo_und$present = 1

# add pseudo-absences
set.seed(100)
geo_und_abs <- rbind(grid_centroids[sample(nrow(grid_centroids),nrow(geo_und), replace = TRUE),"present"],geo_und)

plot(st_geometry(geo_und_abs), col=ifelse(geo_und_abs$present==1,"#ef8a62","#7fbf7b"), main="Geonoma undata", pch = 3)
plot(st_geometry(americas), add=TRUE)

# Phytelephas tenuicaulis
phy_ten = st_as_sf(spec_occ[which(spec_occ$scrubbed_species_binomial == "Phytelephas tenuicaulis"),c("longitude","latitude")], coords = c("longitude", "latitude"), crs = "+proj=longlat +ellps=WGS84 +no_defs")
phy_ten$present = 1

# add pseudo-absences
set.seed(100)
phy_ten_abs <- rbind(grid_centroids[sample(nrow(grid_centroids),nrow(phy_ten), replace = TRUE),"present"],phy_ten)

plot(st_geometry(phy_ten_abs), col=ifelse(phy_ten_abs$present==1,"#ef8a62","#7fbf7b"), main="Phytelephas tenuicaulis", pch = 3)
plot(st_geometry(americas), add=TRUE)


# Mauritia flexuosa
mau_fle = st_as_sf(spec_occ[which(spec_occ$scrubbed_species_binomial == "Mauritia flexuosa"),c("longitude","latitude")], coords = c("longitude", "latitude"), crs = "+proj=longlat +ellps=WGS84 +no_defs")
mau_fle$present = 1

# add pseudo-absences
set.seed(100)
mau_fle_abs <- rbind(grid_centroids[sample(nrow(grid_centroids),nrow(mau_fle), replace = TRUE),"present"],mau_fle)

plot(st_geometry(mau_fle_abs), col=ifelse(mau_fle_abs$present==1,"#ef8a62","#7fbf7b"), main="Mauritia flexuosa", pch = 3)
plot(st_geometry(americas), add=TRUE)
```
&nbsp;


# 4. Load and extract environmental data

**Load environmental data**  
For today's exercise, we use: elevation, temperature ('bio1'), and precipitation ('bio12').  
Please note that temperature has been multiplied by 10.    


```{R, echo=TRUE}
# Import global digital elevation model at 30 arc seconds resolution
elev <- raster("data/mn30_grd")

par(mfrow=c(1,1))
plot(elev) 
```
&nbsp;

```{R, echo=TRUE}
# Import climate data from Chelsa at 30 arc seconds resolution -->
bio1 <- raster("data/CHELSA_bio10_01.tif") # temperature*10
bio12 <- raster("data/CHELSA_bio10_12.tif") # precipitation
plot(bio1)
```
&nbsp;

**Extract environmental data for each point (presences/absences)**
```{r, echo=TRUE}

# extract environmental data for presences and absences
geo_pau_abs$elev <- extract(elev,geo_pau_abs)
geo_pau_abs$bio1 <- extract(bio1,geo_pau_abs)
geo_pau_abs$bio12 <- extract(bio12,geo_pau_abs)
geo_pau_abs <- na.omit(geo_pau_abs)

geo_und_abs$elev <- extract(elev,geo_und_abs)
geo_und_abs$bio1 <- extract(bio1,geo_und_abs)
geo_und_abs$bio12 <- extract(bio12,geo_und_abs)
geo_und_abs <- na.omit(geo_und_abs)

phy_ten_abs$elev <- extract(elev,phy_ten_abs)
phy_ten_abs$bio1 <- extract(bio1,phy_ten_abs)
phy_ten_abs$bio12 <- extract(bio12,phy_ten_abs)
phy_ten_abs <- na.omit(phy_ten_abs)

mau_fle_abs$elev <- extract(elev,mau_fle_abs)
mau_fle_abs$bio1 <- extract(bio1,mau_fle_abs)
mau_fle_abs$bio12 <- extract(bio12,mau_fle_abs)
mau_fle_abs <- na.omit(mau_fle_abs)
```
&nbsp;


# 5.  Building species distribution models  

__One question__  
_What distribution family is used when fitting a logistic regression?_  
a) Normal/Gaussian    
b) Log normal  
c) Binomial  

&nbsp;

**Fit logistic regression models (for each species)**

SDM 1: _Geonoma pauciflora_
```{r, echo=TRUE}
logreg_geo_pau <- glm(present ~ elev + bio1 + bio12, data = geo_pau_abs, family = "binomial")
summary(logreg_geo_pau)
```
&nbsp;

SDM 2: _Geonoma undata_
```{r, echo=TRUE}
logreg_geo_und <- glm(present ~ elev + bio1 + bio12, data = geo_und_abs, family = "binomial")
summary(logreg_geo_und)
```
&nbsp;

SDM 3: _Phytelephas tenuicaulis_ 
```{r, echo=TRUE}
logreg_phy_ten <- glm(present ~ elev + bio1 + bio12, data = phy_ten_abs, family = "binomial")
summary(logreg_phy_ten)
```
&nbsp;

SDM 4: _Mauritia flexuosa_  
```{r,echo=TRUE}
logreg_mau_fle <- glm(present ~ elev + bio1 + bio12, data = mau_fle_abs, family = "binomial")
summary(logreg_mau_fle)
```
&nbsp;

**Check model performance**

We will assess classification precision of the logistic models using ROC (Receiver Operating Characteristic Curve) and AUC (Area Under Curve) for one species (_Mauritia flexuosa_). The ROC curve shows the true positive rate (sensitivity) against the false positive rate (1 - specificity) at various threshold values at which the species may be considered present. The AUC is the area under the ROC curve.  
&nbsp;

```{r, echo=TRUE}
p <- predict(logreg_mau_fle, newdata=mau_fle_abs, type="response")
pr <- prediction(p, mau_fle_abs$present)

prf <- ROCR::performance(pr, measure = "tpr", x.measure = "fpr")
plot(prf, main="Receiver Operating Characteristic Curve")
abline(a=0,b=1)
text(0.9,0.75, "low threshold")
text(0.3,0.05, "high threshold")

```

&nbsp;  

For the ROC, the curve should be located in the upper left of the figure which means that at intermediate threshold values the true positive rate is much higher than the false positive rate.  
&nbsp;  

```{r, echo=TRUE}
auc <- ROCR::performance(pr, measure = "auc")
auc <- auc@y.values[[1]]
auc
```
For the AUC, the value should be greater than 0.50 (i.e. a good model should be correct more than 50% of the time). The higher the AUC, the better the model is at predicting 0s as 0s and 1s as 1s.  
&nbsp;

We can also assess model performance using commonly used indices, such as R^2^, AIC, RMSE, LOGLOSS, and PCP.  
* The Root Mean Square Error (RMSE) is the sqare root of the mean squared residuals (prediction errors). Residuals are a measure of how far from the regression line data points are.  
* LOGLOSS evaluates how good or bad predicted probabilities are (high is bad, low is good).  
* PCP is percentage of correct predictions for models with binary outcomes.  

```{r, echo=TRUE}
model_performance(logreg_geo_und, metrics = c("AIC","R2","RMSE","LOGLOSS","PCP"))
model_performance(logreg_geo_pau, metrics = c("AIC","R2","RMSE","LOGLOSS","PCP"))
model_performance(logreg_phy_ten, metrics = c("AIC","R2","RMSE","LOGLOSS","PCP"))
model_performance(logreg_mau_fle, metrics = c("AIC","R2","RMSE","LOGLOSS","PCP"))
```

# 6. Predict species distributions and compare to actual distributions

**Create new data for predictions**  


```{r, echo=TRUE}
new_extent <- extent(-97, -35, -30, 17) # crop the raster layers to smaller extent

elev <- crop(elev, new_extent) # crop raster layers to smaller extent
elev <- aggregate(elev, fact=4, fun=mean) # aggregate data
plot(elev)
plot(st_geometry(americas),add=TRUE)

bio1 <- crop(bio1, new_extent)
bio1 <- aggregate(bio1, fact=4, fun=mean)
bio12 <- crop(bio12, new_extent)
bio12 <- aggregate(bio12, fact=4, fun=mean)
plot(bio12)
plot(st_geometry(americas),add=TRUE)
```
&nbsp;

**Predict presences of each species using our previously fitted species distribution models**  

```{r, echo=TRUE}

new_data <- data.frame(elev = getValues(elev), bio1 = getValues(bio1), bio12 = getValues(bio12))

# predict presences
geo_pau_predict <- predict(logreg_geo_pau, newdata = new_data, type = "response")
geo_und_predict <- predict(logreg_geo_und, newdata = new_data, type = "response")
phy_ten_predict <- predict(logreg_phy_ten, newdata = new_data, type = "response")
mau_fle_predict <- predict(logreg_mau_fle, newdata = new_data, type = "response")

par(mfrow=c(1,1),mar=c(2,2,2,2))

# create raster layers with SDM predictions
geo_pau_predict_rst <- raster(new_extent, nrows=nrow(elev), ncols=ncol(elev), vals = geo_pau_predict)
geo_und_predict_rst <- raster(new_extent, nrows=nrow(elev), ncols=ncol(elev), vals = geo_und_predict)
phy_ten_predict_rst <- raster(new_extent, nrows=nrow(elev), ncols=ncol(elev), vals = phy_ten_predict)
mau_fle_predict_rst <- raster(new_extent, nrows=nrow(elev), ncols=ncol(elev), vals = mau_fle_predict)

```
&nbsp;


**Compare SDM predictions to actual species ranges**  

```{r, echo=TRUE}

par(mfrow=c(4,2), mar=c(3,1,1,1))

plot(st_geometry(grid), col=ifelse(grid$Geonoma.pauciflora==1,"#7fbf7b","white"), border=FALSE, main = "Geonoma pauciflora")
points(spec_occ$longitude[which(spec_occ$scrubbed_species_binomial == "Geonoma pauciflora")],spec_occ$latitude[which(spec_occ$scrubbed_species_binomial == "Geonoma pauciflora")], pch=3,cex=0.3)
plot(st_geometry(americas),add=TRUE)


plot(geo_pau_predict_rst, main="SDM predictions", axes=FALSE, box=FALSE)
plot(st_geometry(americas),add=TRUE)

plot(st_geometry(grid), col=ifelse(grid$Geonoma.undata==1,"#7fbf7b","white"),border=FALSE, main = "Geonoma undata")
plot(st_geometry(americas),add=TRUE)
points(spec_occ$longitude[which(spec_occ$scrubbed_species_binomial == "Geonoma undata")],spec_occ$latitude[which(spec_occ$scrubbed_species_binomial == "Geonoma undata")], pch=3,cex=0.3)

plot(geo_und_predict_rst,main="SDM predictions", axes=FALSE, box=FALSE)
plot(st_geometry(americas),add=TRUE)


plot(st_geometry(grid), col=ifelse(grid$Phytelephas.tenuicaulis==1,"#7fbf7b","white"), border=FALSE, main = "Phytelephas tenuicaulis")
points(spec_occ$longitude[which(spec_occ$scrubbed_species_binomial == "Phytelephas tenuicaulis")],spec_occ$latitude[which(spec_occ$scrubbed_species_binomial == "Phytelephas tenuicaulis")], pch=3,cex=0.3)
plot(st_geometry(americas),add=TRUE)

plot(phy_ten_predict_rst,main="SDM predictions", axes=FALSE, box=FALSE)
plot(st_geometry(americas),add=TRUE)

plot(st_geometry(grid), col=ifelse(grid$Mauritia.flexuosa==1,"#7fbf7b","white"), border=FALSE, main = "Mauritia flexuosa")
points(spec_occ$longitude[which(spec_occ$scrubbed_species_binomial == "Mauritia flexuosa")],spec_occ$latitude[which(spec_occ$scrubbed_species_binomial == "Mauritia flexuosa")], pch=3,cex=0.3)
plot(st_geometry(americas),add=TRUE)

plot(mau_fle_predict_rst,main="SDM predictions", axes=FALSE, box=FALSE)
plot(st_geometry(americas),add=TRUE)
```
